definition[0]: a shop or person that sells goods cheaply
definition[1]: a shop or business that sells goods or services at lower prices than normal
example[0]: The cameras list for under $1,000, and will be available soon from discounters for as little as $600.
definition[2]: a large shop that has very low prices and a limited number of different products
definition[3]: a financial institution that lends a business an amount of money equal to that owed by the businessâ€™s suppliers
example[1]: The specialist invoice discounters have increasingly sought to distinguish their activities from those of the factoring companies.
